qas.question: When was the first transistor created?
When was the first transistor implemented for practical use?
When did the implementers receive a Nobel Prize for making the transistor?
What list is the transistor on?

answers.text: list of IEEE milestones in electronics

qas.question: When were smaller, cheaper radios introduced?
What besides the transistor is on the IEEE list of milestones in electronics?
What did Julius Lilienfeld receive for inventing the transistor?
Who was the first person to use transistors in calculators?
Why were transistors in 1947 easier to practically implement than transistors in 1926?

context: The transistor is the fundamental building block of modern electronic devices, and is ubiquitous in modern electronic systems. First conceived by <a1_0>Julius Lilienfeld<a1_0/> in <a0_0>1926<a0_0/> and practically implemented in <a2_0>1947<a2_0/> by American physicists John Bardeen, Walter Brattain, and <b8_0>William Shockley<b8_0/>, the transistor revolutionized the field of electronics, and paved the way for <b9_0>smaller and cheaper<b9_0/> radios, calculators, and <b6_0>computers<b6_0/>, among other things. The transistor is on the <a4_0>list of IEEE milestones in electronics<a4_0/>, and Bardeen, Brattain, and Shockley shared the <a3_0><b5_0>1956<b5_0/><a3_0/> <b7_0>Nobel Prize in Physics<b7_0/> for their achievement.
